title: A Tool Comparing Two Fonts
content: I see many graphic designer talk about [this new tool](http://web.archive.org/web/20150112231733/http:/tiff.herokuapp.com/) which lets you compare two fonts and I'd like to see what professional type designers and typophiles think about it. Is there a need for an app like this?
author: sevag

comments.content: Some typefaces don’t align on the same baseline for me, so they’re hard to compare. I prefer to just lay them over each other like that in Illustrator, but I could see the need for comparing with fonts that I don’t own.

With either my graphic designer hat or my type designer hat on, anytime I want to compare fonts, I want to do it in a lot more detail than is available here (or over a broader range of glyphs and in context so as to see metrics, colour & etc.
